intro: Agalmyla serrata, commonly known as the serrated agalmyla, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Agalmyla serrata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
